intro: Verhuellia elegans, commonly known as the elegant verhuellia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Verhuellia elegans is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
